thread.title: Philippines anti-trust regulator starts review of Grab-Uber deal

title: Philippines anti-trust regulator starts review of Grab-Uber deal
text:
April 3, 2018 / 8:37 AM / Updated 4 minutes ago Philippines anti-trust regulator starts review of Grab-Uber deal Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
MANILA (Reuters) - The Philippines’ anti-trust agency said on Tuesday it has started a review of Uber Technologies’ [UBER.UL] deal to sell its Southeast Asian business to ride-hailing rival Grab. FILE PHOTO: A Grab employee uses the Apps to book a cab for passengers at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) in the metro Manila, Philippines, July 22, 2016. REUTERS/Romeo Ranoco 
The Philippine Competition Commission said in a statement it has reason to believe that the deal “may likely substantially lessen, prevent, or restrict competition”. The PCC’s jurisdiction and review procedures are limited to the Philippines. 
The Philippines and Malaysia had said on Monday they will look into whether the deal hinders competition, days after Singapore began a probe into the deal on similar concerns. Reporting by Neil Jerome Morales; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman
